Reviews.Title: “Not worth it even £20 night”
Reviews.Author: Ali A
Reviews.Content: We went to Italy over the Easter holidays. We stayed at what we thought was Golden Tulip but found Isola Sarca as the name printed everywhere in the hotel. We have been in many countries and I have never come across such poor hotel, service, it is not good .One night, the man at the desk with white and grey hair was horrible. The hotel is no where near Rome, is in a place where there is no facilities or tourist places around. We really regretted staying here.The hotel has a Shuttle service which is £12 per person expensive shuttle. We asked the man on the reception if there is any other way to get to Rome but he was rather unhelpful and would not tell us of any other way. We found how to get to Rome ourselves. We caught Co travel bus from outside the hotel to Ostia (lido center) only 10 min, this stops outside the train station from where we got a Train into Rome.It cost us £2 to get into Rome in total from the hotel and £2 to get back. The hotel was charging us a total of £24 per person to Rome and back. Me, my wife and daughter traveled to Rome and back over 3 days for £12 whereas the hotel would have charged us £144. The rooms were not too bad but you could hear other people doors opening and closing very clearly. The young lady serving breakfast was very annoying as she would watch you whilst you got your breakfast and ate it.

Reviews.Title: “If this is a four star hotel then the stars award panel are blind or stupid”
Reviews.Author: ROBERT H
Reviews.Content: I stay their from the 4th of April to the 13 of April 2012, and I have to amit it was one of the worst hotels I have stay in. The indoor pool was nothing but dirty with scum marks around it and so cold. The food was so bad and the service well all I can say if you are white in colour then you will be okay but if like me and ou group who were british Asian then you have had it we were treated so badly by the people in their. We had to asks for bread and butter with our evening meals where the others got it without asking once they were seated at the table. I booked thee hotel through Thomas Cook who told me it was a great hotel and within five minutes walk of the Vatican which was rubbish it was like a good two hour walk and we spent so much on taxis just to get into the town I suggest to anyone booking this hotel be aware the rooms where so awful with the shower unti broken the room was so marked up and dirty and they said it was a superior room and charge those prices. It was going to be a holiday of a life time for me and my girlfriend and family and it turn into a holiday of hell. The only good thing thaat came out of our stay was the receptionist called Meena who try to help us biut her hand was tied as the people who owned the hotel said as we were coloured it did not matter, I found better hotels in rome who were only two stars and three who were better looking and with better service. ROBERT PATEL ENGLAND U.K POSTED ON THE 15TH OF APRIL 2012,

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: deen_foody
Reviews.Content: Staye here with my partner a few months ago, nice place and good value, little bit out of the way but still close enough to enjoy being there

Reviews.Title: “Great price but a little out of the way!”
Reviews.Author: Cerni L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 days after travelling around Italy on honeymoon. We paid £134 for 4 nights in August which was excellent value. We struggled to find our way to the hotel after catching the correct metro but a few wrong buses and then a very kind local couple gave us a lift when we asked for directions as it was quite a walk away. We found the hotel very nice and the pool was lovely and clean, very relaxing after travelling so much. The breakfast was good and rooms very clean. The only drawback was the distance away from the centre of Rome. There is a bus stop around the right of the building which will take you to the metro then into the centre. The metro and buses did run until about 11pm so that wasnt too bad but it is still alot of travelling. We had a vending machine outside our door which was a godsend during the very hot summer. All in all apart from the distance this hotel was great value and no complaints about the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel but not deserving of 4 star rating”
Reviews.Author: shrinkingviolet101
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a short break for my husband and I and chose it over many others because it seemed to be extremely good value for a four star hotel with supposedly excellent facilities, including a pool and spa. I opted to book a chain hotel rather than an independent as I assumed (incorrectly) that it would conform to the 4 star rating it had been given. However, I was very disappointed with the hotel when I arrived. It was miles out of town, a good 25 minute walk to the nearest metro station (although there was a sporadic free shuttle service from the hotel), there was very little in the way of restaurants or shops in the immediate vicinity, the lobby was small and unimpressive and the staff were surly and not particularly welcoming. The lifts were tiny and a bit rickety and our room had a vending machine right outside it, which buzzed and hummed all night. On the positive side, this hotel was quite cheap compared to some others, the room was clean and of a decent size with a fairly comfortable king sized bed and en suite bathroom, and breakfast was included, although some of it was inedible (particularly the scrambled eggs). Perhaps I am being overly picky but the room did not contain any information about the hotel facilities i.e. what was in the fitness suite, when it was open etc, there were no instructions for operating the air conditioning (which didn't seem to do anything other than turn off or heat the room to 26 degrees), no tea or coffee making facilities, and no room service menu even though some scant information on the key card suggested room service was available. In their defence, we probably could have got all this information from the reception staff but as they were less than helpful when we did have occasion to speak to them we didn't bother asking and spent as little time in the hotel as possible. If this hotel had been listed as a 3 star hotel I would not have been so disappointed and for the price I paid it was quite good value. However, I was hoping for something a little more luxurious and feel I was misled by the star rating and the pictures on the hotel website, which make it look nicer than it was. Next time I would opt for something a bit more expensive closer to the city centre or if I was staying on a budget I'd probably opt for an Ibis and give the Golden Tulip a miss.

Reviews.Title: “outdated,out of town,get me out of here”
Reviews.Author: swimmerb0y
Reviews.Content: spent 5 nights at this hotel in mid october.got there at 9ish the first night and after putting our bags in the double room we went to the restaurant for what the receptionsist described as the best pizzas.being a son of italian parents i was eager to try the food .the pizza came out dripping in olive oil and we were presented with the most soggiest pizza ive ever seen yuk !!!!.the head waiter totaly ignored us the two times we went there very rude and unhelpfull.never mind move on we thought.the next day i wanted to try the pools well the indoor pool was broken(we stumbled across this as we passed through the gym area it was all in darkness ???.on to the outdoor pool which was absolutely filthy i love swimming and this was a big factor in booking this hotel as this offered this facilty.what a let down.you just couldnt get in there .in the room there were no tea/coffee facilities so had to have cold drinks instead.we only ate 1 more time in restaraunt and the choice of food was very poor (unless you love fish) breakfast wasnt much better.selection of fruit,croissants toast etc .we couldnt wait to get out of the hotel to be honest.as previous reviews stated you have to get a bus to metro to get anywhere.not much to do around hotel area.there is a supermarket 5 mins away if you need some supplies.1 word of advise for me to give would be take plenty of time to get back to fumicino aiport it took us 4 hours to get back there as the bus/metro/train journey was a nightmare.its only half hour in taxi(prices range from 45-60 euros. overall impression rome is a beautyfull place shame the hotel didnt live up to our expectation the hotel photos must of been taken years ago.shame on you golden tulip for allowing those photos to dupe peaple into thinking this place is a great place to stay and eat.please avoid this hotel as its prob in the worst hotel ive ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Clareshuff
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 20 minute walk/quick bus ride from the end of the Vatican metro line which wasn't a problem for us but I would stay nearer the centre next time - we thought Rome would be chaos but it wasn't that busy and we could easily have coped with staying closer to the centre. The metro stops after 9pm-ish so we ended up coming back early each evening and the buses were infrequent. There was a strike one day so we ended up walking into Rome which took about an hour. The hotel was fine for the price (we paid £300 for four nights through Thomson) and has a lovely seating/eating area round the pool. There are a few rusty odd fittings in the bathroom and the shower cubicle doors don't do a very good job of keeping the water in but the room was big, well air conditioned and the staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed for a short city break and got to enjoy the wonderful sights of Rome and relax at the Golden Tulip after a days sight ”
Reviews.Author: AFitzhugh
Reviews.Content: We were sceptical about this hotel after other reviews but wanted to let you know about our visit. We stayed for 4 nights. The hotel is just outside of the city which is what we were looking for as we wanted to relax after doing all the sights! The hotel has a shuttle which you can book or you can jump on the 546 to the metro station Battistini. This is a very good service which then can take you to all the sights, Vatican, Colloseum etc The hotel has a lovely swimming pool area which you can sunbathe and relax. We spent our evenings having a meal here or a few drinks by the poolside. There was piano music every night which was very pleasant. The hotel food was nice and with the addition of a Pizzeria in September will give more choice. Staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms were a good standard and very clean. We would definately recommend this hotel to friends, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not 4 star.”
Reviews.Author: ScubaChicka
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week with a group of students from Toronto studying abroad. Rooms: -small, especially with 3 to a room (a cot was added) it gets cramped. -not very good storage areas so you can't keep things organized, which makes the size of the room feel even more cramped -good showers, but be careful of the water leaking out through the slit in the door -bathrooms are clean and besides the zero options for storing your toilettries -- there isn't even a shelf or cupboard underneath -- I have nothing to report -windows open well, but you have to yank them really hard to pull them back in (don't worry, you won't break them) Pool: -haven't swam in it yet, but from what the other students say, it is nice -pool area has lots of seating opportunities, and I love the cushioned areas under the cabana-thing -overall, great pool area. They even have tables. Hotel restaurant (as a group of students we are served our food - no ordering): -clean -basic food: pasta or pizza every night, which are usually delicious -dessert isn't that great -free breakfast mostly consists of yoghurt, hard bread, nutella & dressings, tea & coffee (I am very thankful for the tea!), simple cereal (no sugary stuff), juice, canned fruit, and hotel scrambed eggs Complaints: -we were only given one room key, and you have to pay for extra -our hotel WiFi was down for the entire time, so we had to use unlocked networks and roam around the parking lot and lobby looking for a connection. It was a rare excitement when we did get internet access. -the walls are thin, so sleep is very difficult with screaming, giggly, hyper teenage girls in the hallway (admittedly, the girls from my studying trip, but I tried not to associate with them. Many customers in nearby rooms got very upset with the noise level) -laundry rates are very high, but then again I've never used hotel laundry before, so maybe they are normal -hotel is about a 5 minute walk from the bus stop, then usually another 10-15 minute wait for the bus, 5-10 minutes bus ride to the metro. Week-long metro tickets cost 16 euros, or 1 euro for each ride. Your best bet is getting the week pass. *Tip: our first night sleeping, I was freezing. To control the air conditioning: shut it off, turn it up before bed, or open the window which automatcially turns off the AC. I give this hotel 3 stars because it is basic but acceptable. The front desk is pretty nice, but twice already I've handed in the key to them and they didn't have it in our room slot (we had to hand in our keys before going out, but I think that's a student group thing). I just hope they didn't charge us for "losing it".

Reviews.Title: “Bad Hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldonline
Reviews.Content: This hotel is to far from town! We had to walk to the bus 3-5 minutes, take the bus to the subway (15 minutes), take the subway to town 10 minutes. You will be tired from the trip..it's horrible. After two days we took a cap for 40 euro (two way). The hotel is really cheap and the service is very bad. They can't speak english. The most horrible was you had to walk into a door/hall behind that there where two doors (left and right). Our neighbours were standing up at 6.00 o clock and when they left the door bangs very hard. It's just a stupid construction. Oh and the swimmming pool is filthy! They don't clean it and you don't want to know what people are doing there when they are buying private time. So don't go!! it's filthy, noisy, bad service and far from town.

Reviews.Title: “Rome was Superb”
Reviews.Author: speedtalk
Reviews.Content: I was apprehensive coming to this hotel and over reacted to the reports, even purchasing a rubber swim cap. It is a tired 4 star in need of renovation. Some rust in bathrooms and yes leaking showers. Stained carpets throughout the bedroom and passageways. Our room was very noisy, could not work out what was causing the noise, thought it may have been expansion as the early morning sun blazed on to the glass of the hotel. Service is very good overall, although our requested early call did not happen. The pool is very good, did not have to wear the cap. Only saw a maximum of 8 at the pool at any one time. I did not check what towels were given at reception but other than ourselves, the other guests appeared to be using room towels. We had one evening meal and it was excellent but not cheap. As for bacon at breakfast, all you have to do is ask. “Alessio”, he supplied bacon and scrambled egg within 5 minutes of my request on the 2 days when it had all gone. Appears to be mainly a business hotel. Cornelia is 5 to 10 minutes by the number 889 bus which comes approx every 10 minutes. Bought the 3 day metro/bus rover ticket (11 euro) on the Monday and it activates the first time you use it (activated on Tuesday). As already mentioned hardly anybody appears to pay on the buses. No restaurants nearby just cafes. One supermarket that is very good. Rome is expensive, I may be stating the obvious, draught beer, nastro etc. half a litre from 5 to 7 euro. Most sights are free, St Peters, Pantheon. Queue at St Peters 500 metres 1000am took 30 minutes only to get in, big security to get in. Vatican 15 euro, Collosseum 12 euro plus 5 euro for guide. Every tourist spot is crowded. At the popular sites you are accosted by dozens of touts selling tours, pretended not to understand the many languages they tried, but we must have looked English. An Italian gentleman recommended a restaurant to us and it was excellent food and value. Ask for the fixed menu not listed, 23 euro each, appears both must have it. Three courses, pasta, main course (try branzino con payaye suttili (fish)), desert, plus half a bottle of house wine each. Near the British Embassy to the East, called Al Grappolo D’oro in street called Via Palestro 4-10.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BBChef
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel, yes it is far from everything but we took the bus to the metro and then the metro to all the sights. Their restaurant is also very very good and have a great atmosphere by the pool it really doesn't feel that you are in a big city, very relaxing. I found the staff to be very helpful and friendly too, overall a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: JohnsonsOz
Reviews.Content: We got a shuttle from the airport. 50 euros. The train to Cornelia then bus or taxi would have been much cheaper. Bus leaves for the metro just opp. the hotel 1 euro for 75 mins. Great value. We walked to Cornelia a few times. Not the prettiest suburb but nice and quiet. Enjoyed the hotel. Room lovely. Breakfast very good. Staff friendly and helpful. Only ate once at the hotel but that was also very good. Laundromat just down the hill but closed weekends. No problem with getting into Rome. On the Vatican line. Mini bar no problem for as as we don't drink. It was our first trip to Italy and we were very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “A very poor hotel - Heating broken, bed broken, robbed by room maid, etc ...”
Reviews.Author: daydreams000
Reviews.Content: Run away from this hotel ... The central heating regulation is broken. We had 28C in the room during the 3 nights we stayed. I called the reception to get if fixed. They told me to wait 5 min they would call me back. They did call me back saying they found a solution: "open the window" ;-) Great ! Then I realized that most of the windows were open. The central heating regulation is broken in all rooms ! My bed was broken as well. A big hole in the middle. Like if an elephant, or maybe 2, sat for 1 week in the middle of it. Well, then I had to sleep in my wife's arms in her bed, which is not bad at all afterwards ! We wanted to try the swimming pool. Looking at their website it looks nice ... and free .... You have to pay 20 Euros ... per person ... for 30 min ... Well we did not use it for such a price ! We booked the hotel nights with vouchers we bought at "daydreams". On top of the vouchers, the hotel asked us to pay 100 Euros by night for breakfast and dinner. We thought for that price we get a nice dinner ..... No way. They don't give you the menu card. You get a standard meal with no choice: pasta as appetizer and then 4 tinny slices of cold roastbeef. With salad. With no dressing. You have to ask for oil and vinegar. Luckyly you don't pay for it. But you pay extra for the water. The 100 Euros beautiful dinner does not include beverage. And last but not least, when we arrived at home we realized that they stole us the nice presents we bought for our friends while they were cleaning the room .... And by the way, when you ask for a taxi at the reception, they will propose you their shuttle at a fixed price of 55 Euros to go to the airport. Refuse it. A taxi to the airport costs around 40 Euros (taxi station in front of the hotel). For Wifi, you have to pay extra as well.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel, fully satisfied.”
Reviews.Author: varya_podoprigora
Reviews.Content: I read reviews on this hotel when I was booking a room to stay in Rome, and the other people's opinions made me uncertain about my choice. However my impression about the hotel is very good: clean room, good service, helpful personnel. The location of the hotel isn't perfect (you have to walk to the metro station for about half of an hour), but there is a bus station right next to the hotel. Anyways, the hotel neighborhood is nice and green and it was a pleasure for us just to walk our way to the metro each time. All the standard hotel services were good and we had no problems with them: wonderful breakfast, free internet service, laundry service, shuttle service to Fumiccino airport. The reception desk had always somebody speaking English, and they were always friendly, polite and eager to answer all our questions any time of the day or night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay - 4 Days in Rome”
Reviews.Author: phillmax11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I use trip advisor to review all our hotels prior to booking however never commented on any of the hotels we have booked, but felt the need to do so for this hotel due to its mixed reviews mostly from 2008-2009. We stayed as The Golden Tulip for 3nights/4 days paying £250 through expedia for bed & breakfast. Pro's... Excellent sized room, clean and tidy, with LCD t.v, touser press, FREE safe,air conditioning(contact reception to have switched on),large marble tiled bathroom with power shower and hairdryer. Hotel is good size, clean & modern with 6 floors, good sized swimming pool with terraced area, restaurant, bar, Gym (excellent -Technogym equipment), sauna & jacuzzi and shuttle bus. Breakfast - No issues as previous reviews highlight otherwise,clean and no waiting. Choice of fruit, breads,cheese& meats, cereal, juices, yoghurt, cakes,tea and coffee. Only hot food was scrambled egg. Check in 1200. Nearby - Supermarket, 2 Restaurants, Pharmacy,Bus Terminal, Couple of takeaway stalls. Centre of Rome is really easy to get to from hotel and we cannot understand the negative feedback re location. To be honest we both loved getting out the hustle and bustle and noise of the city after walking around all day. You can get to Rome tourist spots using the metro from either Battistini or Cornelia Stations and get off at either the vatican city, spanish steps etc and it only takes 6-7 minutes. You can get to Battistini or Cornelia station using either bus 546 or 889 both from bus terminal outside hotel. The bus service is every 5 minutes,and finishes at 0000. The metro is every 2 minutes. If walking from metro you can get to hotel in 15minutes on a relatively straight forward route from Battistini metro stop. Despite the grafiti(throughout whole city) the area was safe to walk at night. You can get a 3 day tourist pass that covers buses and tube for 11euro's each person buying it from metro station. You walk on and off the bus and we never showed the ticket once. Public transport was great and we never had to use taxis or open top bus due to its good service. There was also storage available for cases,and showers in the gym to feshen up prior to late flight. Negatives - There are only a few but if changed would have made this hotel great. Sauna & Jacuzzi - Can only be booked as "Romantic Moments" charged at 20euro's per person for 30minutes! Swimming pool - You must have a swimming cap, and own towel(not room towels), otherwise hotel will sell a cap and rent towels. Minibar- Well overpriced. a can of diet coke is 4Euro's, but you can buy one across the road from stall at 1.50euro. From Champiano airport you can get several allocated buses to Rome Railway Station (TERMINI), including teravision at 4euro's each. Be aware in peak traffic(like when we arrived at 9am) it can take 1hour 20minutes plus 20 minute wait in queue at bus terminal. We found the best way to get the public transport bus at 1.20euro each from the airport to Anagnina (first train station on metro line A) which takes 15minutes by bus. Then board tube at Anagnina and get off at either TERMINI(15minutes)or stay on tube all the way to Hotel, Battistini(approx25-30 minutes from angina). Check out this map; http://www.propertyinvesting.net/cgi-script/csNews/image_upload/specialreports_2edb.roma-metro-map-rome-italy.jpg Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for - and not much else”
Reviews.Author: high_flyer20
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok if you want to stay relatively close to the city centre for a reasonable price. But the restaurant is really bad (be aware) and you have to fight for your breakfast. The entire breakfast buffet is a complete mess and there is virtually no food available for guests. And all the tables are messy. Go somewhere else if you want good food. And the pool closes quite early. And the room service is way too expensive, 10 euros charge. And don't order the bruschetta. It is really bad.

Reviews.Title: “dont be disheartened by other reviews”
Reviews.Author: chef001
Reviews.Content: after reading some reviews of this hotel naturally we were concerned on arrival ...but fear not. On arrival, which was very simple following hotels directions from termini via metro and buses, we were greeted by polite, friendly and efficient staff. The rooms....more than big enough room with plenty of storage space, mini bar and tv with various channels from europe. Restaurant is overpriced but is the pretty much the only place to eat after 7pm in the area of the hotel, hoever after 7pm if you head to cornelia metro station there are many restaurants, cafes and coffee bars open if not eat whilst out, this said the quality of the food at hotel is very good from my experience especially steak and veal. Wine is from 15 euros and you will pay more if you eat by poolside. Local amenities there is a little coffee bar next door which is perfectly fine and also one opposite bus stop ...however don not buy wine from there its pretty rank. 5 mins walk from hotel is cts supermercato which offers stunnng value for money. As for public transport the local buses where frquent mon to sat, we used 546 to battstini but believe the 889 to cornelia to be the better option as it runs direct from metro to hotel.. This said the safe in one of our rooms was not working and was not fixed during our 5 day stay, be prepared to be biten when by poolside as there are lots of them around. Also when taking showers the bathroom floor flooded each time but this is down to the design of shower door and nothing to do with hotel staff. All in all no major complaints and i would have no issues in returning

Reviews.Title: “Nice and simple”
Reviews.Author: Jemo1967
Reviews.Content: Generally the hotel is comfortable, but best of all was the friendly servant Antonio (Nabil) and Mr Alesandro, and the worst was the female receptionists.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel....it made my weekend in rome just perfect”
Reviews.Author: lalover1977
Reviews.Content: i have been in this hotel for a short weekend in rome...i knew that it wasnt in the center of the city so we had to take a taxi to get there..but besides thia i have 100 reasons to suggest this hotel to pther travellers...the room was perfect..very clean and with a great look..bathroom and shower just perfect.The breakfast was included in the price and it had everything..croissants,different kind of cakes,cereals,eggs,bacon and besides that the coffee tasted great.the main reason why i chose this hotel was the swimming pool..and i gotta be honest..it was great..i asked for a late check outjust to have a chance to use it again...its a pool with like 2 different levels..and there is a part where u can just sit in there and relax like if u were in a jacuzzi..i had lunch twice at the restaurant and it was good...thumbs up for the waitress and the waiter..very friendly and nice.Last thing i gotta say about this hotel..the receptionist,Aurelio,was great..very friendly and professional..all receptionists should be like him!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value but be prepared to take taxi at night.”
Reviews.Author: dlsmLondon
Reviews.Content: We paid £225 pounds for the flight and hotel for two nights which was good value.From the airport we took the train to Termini (11 euros) and then the metro to Cornelia and bus 889 to the hotel (1 euro). On arriving we were able to check in earlier and the receptionist was friendly. The room was very clean and quiet and breakfast buffet okay. Yes - there are plastic cups for the juice but a cappuccino would be specially made if requested.We didn't bother taking the hotel shuttle to the metro as there were always buses waiting outside on the left of the hotel. The cost of travel is 1 euro for 75 minutes travel for buses and the metro. The vatican city was only three stops on the metro which was fast. Walking around Rome is easy and a good way to see the city. Taxis back to the hotel late at night cost about 17 euros. In the day we took the metro.It was easier for us to take a taxi back to the airport and as we hadn't prebooked we were charged 50 euros on a sunday (it is normally 40 euros from the city to the airport).

Reviews.Title: “4* hotels are meant to leave you feeling good”
Reviews.Author: Roussillon-Property
Reviews.Content: Hotel looks good from the outside. Reception staff very friendly and speak good English. It was also a bonus to be able to check into our room in the morning. When I go to a 4* hotel in a major capital city, I do not expect to find glasses and litter lying in the swimming pool nor do I expect to find the previous nights merriment still littered around the pool tables. (10:30 am.) The room was passable but very small for a superior double and the men carrying out building works at 08:00 was a little annoying. The mini bar was still in place but empty and had been replaced with a vending machine in the corridor. Not 4*. We had one evening meal in the restaurant...The bar did not serve Gin & Tonic and the advertised Bistro restaurant was closed. Our starter never arrived, The main course was excellent but the advertised cheese platter was now missing from the menu. Breakfast was frankly a disgrace. The hot milk had been burnt, both mornings. Fruit juice was served in cheap plastic cups. If I go to a service station or a greasy spoon, I can get better than this, so all in all very disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Too far out to really enjoy Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Adamslocks
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is to far out of the city to really enjoy the delights of Rome. When you arrive at Cornelia station it is a good 2 mile walk to the hotel. You can catch the 889 bus on via Bocca but after 7.00pm these seem to run irregularly. Also the walk back to the hotel is through a resedentail area and is quite dark the path is very uneven and dog mess everywhere. On arriving at the airport I would advise that a taxi to the hotel would be a good option a lugging a case through the Rome metro is not the easiest thing to.do. The Hotel were pleasant if not the most helpful. The safe in our room was broken after asking for it to be repaired a Porter came to our room and hit it a few time and confirmed that it was broken. Sorry. You can use the hotel safe in Reception. Also the air con broke after the 1st night. Sorry nothing we can do was the answer we got. Agree on other comment on possible bed bugs as both my wife and I were bitten every night. Shower leaked and smelled of damp and mould. Be prepared to clear your own table when coming down for breakfast and obtain cutlery plates etc from other tables to make your place up. There is also a nightclub beneath the hotel that runs until 5am on Friday/Saturday night.OK if you like that but if your air con is broken and you have to open the window then House music all night long is not good. The one good thing about the hotel was the pool. Very clean and if you can get the two sun loungers then very relaxing to sit out at. Restaurant is OK but a bit pricey and better meals can be had out in Rome. Supermarket 5 minute walk from hotel for water etc. Wi/fi 2 euros for 30 mins. Only in the lobby area. Not a very fast connection To get in to Rome from the hotel if you cannot get on the shuttle bus as only 8 seats. You need to take the bus 889 to Cornelia and then Metro Line A . Or the buses 46/916 from Cornelia into Rome. These buses go straight pass the Vatacan. Coming back from Cornelia catch the 889 to val Canute.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Tulip, Bellambriana, Rome”
Reviews.Author: MorayTravellers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Rome last week and stayed in the Golden Tulip Hotel. Never again! On arriving in Rome we followed the instructions for getting to the hotel via the train and metro only to find ourselves in a most undesirable location trying to find a taxi or bus to take us to the hotel. We wandered around aimlessly for around an hour (suitcases in tow) until we eventually found a taxi rank which took us to the hotel. The hotel staff were not very friendly, the rooms were ok, but this was no 4 star hotel. The rooms werent cleaned particularly well and the staff were not at all helpful or friendly. The buffet breakfast was very basic and there always seemed to be hardly anything left. Day 2 we were given instructions that there was a bus outside the hotel that would take us to the nearest metro station which turned out to be around a 15 minute ride. (I think the hotel state on their website that the nearest metro is around 0.8km which we thought we could easily walk (but not in that district). Then you have a metro ride to wherever you were going in the City. The last bus back to the hotel at night was at 11pm so this curtailed our evenings in Rome as we had to leave around 9pm to make our way back to the hotel. Overall, the hotel was basic, not in a good location and we would not recommend this hotel to anyone considering a trip to Rome. Get a hotel in the city centre even if you have to pay that bit more!

Reviews.Title: “Too far out of the way!! Shocking rudeness from a lady receptionist...”
Reviews.Author: wigangary
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend were advised to get the metro to Cornelia however upon arriving there we were completely lost - it was certainly not the 0.8km from the station as detailed on Lastminute.com more like 2.0km and even the taxi drivers struggled to know where it was (after we found a taxi driver!). There was one extremely rude lady receptionist whom barked out several times that she was trying to work whilst on the telephone when we stood talking to a fellow American tourist at the reception area. However there was an extremely nice and professional waiter/concierge. On our final day of a 3-day stay we mastered the transport system but the bus service to and from the hotel to the metro were unpredictable at best. The lifts seem to run all night and were noisy that coupled with the loud hotel room entry key door buzzer made sure you had to either take your ear plugs or have plenty of wine before getting off to bed! Having said that we enjoyed the food & wine from the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer service, "barebones" rooms, outlying location”
Reviews.Author: RigVeda
Reviews.Content: I came to Rome to experience the amazing historical city, I was truly impressed by the history and culture of that city. However, the hotel that I stayed at has much to be desired. The rooms are comfortable and adequate and the free cold continental breakfast is what one would expect (general breads, no warm dishes, limited selection of fruits if any, and generous number of jams/ spreads in plastic containers). I have been to many hotels in my working career, and in all honestly, i was shocked by the hotel staff's indiference and general lack of honesty in dealing with their clients. I had left my suit by mistake in my room, upon arriving back in my home country I contacted them. They let me know that they had found the suit and they had moved it to their offices. I requested that they please send me the suit to my address and offered to pay for all expenses incurred. They flatly refused to assist in any way, insisting that I should organise this myself and pay for it myself. (Most hotels send customer's left items to them free of charge). After much hangling with other Italian courier companies, I came to the conculsion that I could not do it myself and would need their help. I escalated this to Golden Tulip's Global Customer Service (which was not any better at all). To cut a long story short, when I tried to contact Bellambriana again, they stated that the suit was not there any more (it was apparently stolen). Since then they have been very difficult to get hold of, sometimes refusing to answer my calls, or making excuses to deal with me (Stating that they cannot speak) PLEASE AVOID for your sanity!!

Reviews.Title: “A Management Disaster”
Reviews.Author: SaturdaysChild25
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were booked in to this hotel after the one we chose through Expedia closed suddenly. As we had little notice we accepted it. We have stayed at Golden Tulip hotels in Venice and Amsterdam and were very happy with those, but this one needs sorting out. As at least one other reviewer wrote the best feature was a restaurant staffer named Johnny - pleasant, courteous and always helpful. The restaurant was excellent - good food and staff who went out of their way to provide good service, on one late night producing excellent meals fast even though they were about to close. The front desk staff were not. They were offhand, bordering on rudeness and only occasionally welcoming. The worst were incompetent. The management of this part of the hotel was completely lacking. Problems with room heating, computer access and the booking of the free minibus to the Metro station were frequent. We booked places on the minibus four times - it was generally good, but twice ran fifteen minutes late and on the fourth occasion left (on time) as we got to the lobby - the drivers never checked the room numbers of guests who booked - he just went. We obtained a taxi via the desk - it arrived quickly but there was no hint of apology or recompense from the desk staff, or suggestion that the minibus, on its return, would take us in to the station. The girl had no idea of a helpful response. The hotel is well out of the city in an area devoid of eating places and nearby transport - hence the minibus service to Cornelia Metro station. We arrived at 3pm on the Sunday to find there was no food available and three different times were given for the restaurant to open - the dreadful young lady on duty (she who later failed to apologise for the missed minibus) clearly didn't know the correct time and equally clearly couldn't care less. The breakfasts were good, if mainly carbohydate-based - tinned fuit and yoghourts were provided - but tables were being serviced poorly and some cutlery needed to be raided from wherever it could be found. The rooms were smart and clean and well serviced, though they had small problems of damage and our first room had defective air conditioning so we moved to another. I teach tourism management at university level: apart from Johnny and his fellow restaurant staff this hotel proves that Golden Tulips can, in fact, tarnish badly.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: carlieandrea
Reviews.Content: reading the other reviews I almost feel like I stayed at a different hotel. My experience at the golden tulip Bellambriana was very enjoyable. First of all I had just come from traveling in eastern Europe and to get to my room and see the enormous size of my kind size bed was only the beginning! The staff were very friendly and helpful, I don't speak Italian really, but everyone seemed to get by with English. They gave me a map and explained how I could get to the city, where was good for shopping, eating etc. The city center is only a short bus or metro ride away and the public transportation in Rome is very clean and easily accessible. The bus stop is literally right outside the hotel entrance. There is a beautiful pool and outside area to lay under and relax. The breakfast was good, what you would expect, cereals, toast, cold cuts and fresh espresso. Overall this hotel helped my experience in Rome be a wonderful one that I will never forget. I definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a nice place to stay slightly outside of the city bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel & Staff”
Reviews.Author: italyvacation08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and it was more than enough, We couldn't wait to get out of there. The staff are not a bit helpful, especially at the reception desk, very rude and not a bit polite.REceptionist couldn't recommend a single restaurant aprt from their own to dine at & she also refused to give us change for the bus. they do have a shuttle bus but it only takes 8 people at a time and you have to book it in advance. It stops at 6.30pm and doesnt' run on saturdays! The walls in our room were all dirty and looked as if they hadn't been painted in a while. As for the location, it is really far from the city and in a run-down area. You have to get a train and a bus and its not a safe area so you could not go for a walk in the area. There was a burnt out car on the road outside the hotel. The restaurant food is not very nice, I had steak fillet but it was just a lump of fatty meat served with 5 french fries and the fries alone were €8.00! I booked this hotel because it looked nice on the internet, it was cheap and it was suppose to be in the vatican area. Would definately not return there even if there was no charge!!

Reviews.Title: “Ruined my Italy trip”
Reviews.Author: CanuckinTexas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 6 nights in June while I attended a conference. The hotel is located in a suburban area outside of Rome, nowhere near the city attractions. The buses are unreliable, it's a 25 minute walk to the metro stop, and the cab drivers can't find it. The people at the front desk should be doing anything other than dealing with people. They make no attempt at being friendly or helpful. This is where it gets good. When we went to check out, the guy at the front desk informed me that I had the room booked for one more night. I showed him my reservation confirmation, showing the check out for that day and a reservation for another hotel in northern Italy for that night and his response was: "you have the room booked for one more night and you have to pay." He could not show me any papers indicating that I had the room for one more night. After a heated discussion, my wife and I left and walked to the bus stop with our luggage. About 5 minutes later, 2 guys drive up and tell me to get back to the hotel. I refused to get in the car so one of them "escorted" me back to the hotel on foot, leaving my wife and the luggage at the bus stop. I was taken to a room behind the front desk where I argued with 4 characters for about 20 minutes. Then the police showed up. To make a long story short, a discussion in Italian ensued and after another 15 minutes or so, a policeman asked for my confirmation paper. He looked at it and let me go. I walked back to the bus stop, where my shaken wife was waiting. If you are going to Rome, get a hotel in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not as pretty as the pictures on the website”
Reviews.Author: boihack
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing. We picked this hotel because it was suppose to be close to the airport (we had a 6:45 AM flight the next day), it took us 25 minutes to get to the airport at 4:30 in the morning (not to close). Very modern hotel. Had to put a card key in the slot to get the electricy and airconditioning to work. When you left your room obviously with your key, the air would shut off and when you return to your room it was hot. Only the front desk staff could regulate your air temp. We wanted to use the pool, but we were told the pool is closed due to a private party, how can a big hotel like this close the pool to other guest in June. Front dest staff was friendly, she arranged a taxi to the airport for us. Definately would not stay here again and would not recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat put the way!”
Reviews.Author: Sun_seeking_ginner
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference in the convention centre near the Leonardo Di Vinci Airport, and it was one of the hotels recommended by the conference web page. The hotel is modern and has a nice pool area, the room was comfortable and clean, but the air conditioning would switch on for a minute then switch itself off - not good when its 28 degrees. It is also miles from anywhere. The nearest metro stations are a 15 minute or more walk, which is fine but the last tube is at 2230. But getting to the conference centre was a nightmare by public transport. Luckily the hotel did provide a limited shuttle service. I would not recommend this hotel if you are traveling to Rome for a tour of the sites as it is a 25 Euro taxi ride to the centre and the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “beware bar bill”
Reviews.Author: corokia
Reviews.Content: Rooms clean and attractive. Appearance rather than function, lots of things didn't work, our fancy towel rail fell off the wall and the hose off the hairdryer.. No air con, though it was hot [ 27 c at night] They said to open a window Our window overlooked a building site, looks like an extension to the hotel. . They did put out nice fluffy towels each day. Some staff helpful, some weren't. We were with a group, we got no choice of food for dinner. First courses were rather good, downhill after that. Breakfasts were OK, lots of choice. They did produce a meal when we [49 of us] arrived at 2am [ thanks to easyJet] It is very hard to get out of the main pool, the steps stop short. of the top. The jacuzzi was only switched on once briefly, despite requests. The pool area was pleasant. Be very careful buying a drink, a number of us were badly overcharged. Ask price first. They asked 18 euros for 2 gin and tonics, we were charged 10 euros for 2 small lemonades. I think this hotel is run with single business men in mind. eg) the coat hangers were only good for trousers, none for skirts.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: chicopus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal, if you are a single Italian businessman - because that is who this hotel is designed for. And, as with much that is Italian - it looks great, but things fall apart when you touch them! On the plus side - it is clean, confortable, and the staff are friendly and helpful (our large party turned up at 1.00am, and they had dinner waiting for us) On the downside - the air conditioning was not switched on because it wasn't summer (even though us poor Brits were suffering from the heat in late May!), the advertised internet connections are none existent (which seems to be an Italy-wide problem), and we were grossly overcharged at the bar (DONT buy mixers in bottles) This hotel is a little outside of the centre of Rome, but the Metro and a local bus meant that it is still relatively convenient. There are no bars or restaurants nearby, and the views on the food at the hotel were variable.

Reviews.Title: “Staff problems”
Reviews.Author: Snatadry
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 4 nights at this hotel. As a single my room was fine although not overly clean, especially the bathroom. I found a 6" long dark hair in my bed and I have short grey hair! However, my strongest criticism is regarding the staff. They were surly and unobliging. As an example, I bought a bottle of wine ( from the hotel of course) to use over a couple of nights and when I went on the second evening and asked at the bar for it to be taken from the fridge for a pre dinner drink, the bottle was dumped on the bar in front of me and then the bar person walked away and I had to ask him to come back to give me a glass. This sort of thing went on all the time, at breakfast and dinner also. I was with a tour company ( of which I have no complaints at all) but have to say that given it was a tour, the food at this hotel was awful. Very bland, no vegetables to speak of, tinned fruit at breakfast and just not very appetising.

Reviews.Title: “Priceline users beware!”
Reviews.Author: Lyn B
Reviews.Content: Priceline gives this hotel 3 stars. I asked many guests how they booked this hotel and the answer was Priceline - same as me. This hotel is bad for so many reasons. They first put us in a room that had soiled bed linens. They charged us to use the internet in the room, but I could never get a connection. The hotel is miles from anything noteworthy. There is nothing within walking distance - not even a restaurant. The restaurant in the hotel itself is not very good. The front desk staff was unfriendly at best.

Reviews.Title: “Modern but a thousand miles from nowhere”
Reviews.Author: NYstrele
Reviews.Content: we booked this room through hotwire.com for a bargain price of $129 a night. but by the time we added expensive taxi cabs and transportation, we realized we had hardly gotten the deal we were expecting. first, the hotel is comfortable and ultra-modern. amenities were ok (nice pool), though wireless was 10 euro extra. staff was not overly friendly, but provided the essentials. the problem is, of course, location. as other reviews attest, the hotel is miles outside of the city and you hardly feel like you're even in rome. be advised: there is a local bus steps from the hotel that takes you to the cornelia metro stop -- the subway in rome is ultra clean and safe, so once you figure out the public transportation options, it is possible to get from here to there without spending a fortune. overall, i suggest you dig deeper to find a hotel within the beautiful city of rome. there are so many small boutique hotels that offer the charm of the city. the golden tulip feels like a business hotel... pretty generic. and by the way, breakfast is super lousy. overall, a C+.

Reviews.Title: “A four-star impostor”
Reviews.Author: guddeniel
Reviews.Content: Really can't say I'd want to set foot again in that hotel. Far away from the sights, from the metro and poorly served by buses and taxis it really can be defined an ultimately tiring experience, especially difficult to find if you don't speak the language or are good at reading maps of the suburbs. If you choose it you really ought to be keen on walking, especially up the stairs. I've never seen a slower and more irritating pair of elevators. I don't exagerate in saying that it took ten full minutes to take it up and down from the fifth floor. After one day we were already walking up and down the backdoor steps. I totally agree that the service is bad, quite pushy in the restaurant, where you are almost forced into ordering things that you don't want, and everything in the rooms, although pretty new, seems disquietingly malfunctioning (except for the television). The cold showers are a definite low, can confirm. And dulcis in fundo it can happen to get money stolen in your room, or that your safe need some repairing and won't open. I'd strongly recommend a friend not to settle for this four-star impostor. I have seen better places with fewer stars blush way harder for smaller inconvenients; can't really say the personnel is neither particularly experienced nor skilled nor welcoming, and the ultimate shock was learning after a 45 minute wait that the taxi we called was indeed not coming as we thought because of rain. So look harder, you're bound to find something better in beautiful Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: Beatriz009
Reviews.Content: Ive just been there. Spent four days with a group of people. I was really disappointed.Why? Many reasons. The hotel is very out of the way,difficult to find. If you think of using public transportation you'll find yourself having to take a bus to get to a metro station (there are none close by) which is tyring. If you are thinking of taking a cab (taxis) think twice: not only it's very expensive but also if it's a rainy day no taxi driver will take his/her time to drive up to the hotel (personal experience). Breakfast is the poorest thing ive seen in a four star! Ive had much better breakfeasts at three stars, even two stars. Walls thin and no hot water in the morning!!!!!!!! They said it was not the hotels problem but the neighbourhood's.(????????? they use a communal heater???right) It was like that every single morning we stayed there..so my advice..shower at night. What else...mmm yes we got 50 euros a head stolen from us( two people two different rooms) !!!!! I might be ingenous but it is the first time in my LIFE its happenned to me. If I say ive been to around 35 hotels I can tell you im not exageratting. I travel a lot, a big lot. Mainly trough europe and Ive never ever been robbed before. All they said to us is " 1. We have to check because its never happenned to us before" then. "2. You might have spent them and don't remember having done so" (??????????what??). And last, after angry emails, a nice call "3. We are sorry. We try to do our best. You are invited to our hotel anytime" FINNALLY THEY SAID SORRY! But I will not take their offer. Specially when they tryed to charge us for a bottle of water WE BOUGHT and did not put in the fridge????? Furniture: A friend cut his finger (eldery man ) just by passing his fingers on the furniture (modern- steel -ready to cut fingers decoration). Yeap, and remeber , each room only gets 5 hangers.Yeap, we checked. No internet. No white or yellow pages at the information desk..(?basic at any hotel?? the phone guide??) And last but not least...la cassaforte broke...and they didnt consider themselves responsible for it.They wouldn't give us a solution." We don't have the key" Only when we mentioned "police" if they didn't get it open(with 3000 euro inside you would have been mad too) they started to move. What can I say. It's nothing personal against those employees that may be doing a great job. But seriously, overall its an awful hotel that made our trip so much worse ( we had another problem but that was self infflicted). I don't recommend it and if you want a good advice: DON'T GO THERE!

Reviews.Title: “Golden Tulip Review”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not easy to find and the directions supplied on the website could be better. My wife and I got a taxi from the airport and the driver had a problematic time finding it. Unfortunately this was repeated with other drivers during our stay. The area is not the nicest part of Rome and is a long distance from the sights. There is a bus stop outside the hotel and a taxi rank. The nearest metro station is about 1.5 miles away. The room was comfortable and adequate but nothing special. If you want to use the mini bar you need to get the porter to open it for you, the first time I've ever seen this in a hotel. The bar is very small and seems to close when the bartender feels they want to go home. The restaurant in the hotel is better avoided. You can eat better and cheaper elsewhere. I loved Rome and would go back but would stay elsewhere.

HotelInfo.Name: Golden Tulip Bellambriana
HotelInfo.Address: Via Lucca Passi 6, 00166 Rome, Italy
